JP, there are such things as scannners. Spelled s-c-a-n-n-e-r-s, I 
believe. Anyways, they're mysterious devices that can pick up the 
energy signatures of things, and they just happened to pick up your 
army of bots departing from a base, so that's how the Alliance knows 
the location of your base.

::Supernova/Flare/Scrap/Vycir/Slasys/Zardus::

"Their weapon grid is online." Reports Vycir as the two jets approach 
Hell Beast's base, scanning ahead. The defences that they picked up 
were nothing to worry about. The Galactors were designed for almost 
any type of battle situation, and attacking a base was one thing they 
were good at.

The two jets spread out, their scanners keeping track of the EMP 
pulse cannon.

"Don't get close, simply fry them from afar," Supernova orders, that 
jet making a sharp right to fly away from the base, leaving two 
missiles heading for it. The Vycir/Slasys jet makes a sharp left, 
firing several laser bolts at the shields.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Zardus frowns, looking at the scanners and watching the Galactors 
engage in combat. He doubted they could take the base alone, but he 
had hoped that the move would have drawn Hell Beast back away from 
the CF. It didn't. But no matter, he had other cards to play.

Zardus taps a few keys, opening a comm channel to DrillBit. DrillBit 
had some rather negative dealings with Hell Beast before, though 
Zardus didn't know as much as he would have wanted about the 
situation between those two grroops of Predacons.

"Commander DrillBit," he says over the comm, "This is Commander 
Zardus of the Alliance. My troops are currently attacking Hell 
Beast's base. I believe a joint attack on him would benefit both our 
factions. Our troops fighting together would undoubtedly be able to 
take his base without too much trouble. I await your responce."

Zardus sits back, looking at the base monitoring systems for more 
info on the Unitron situation.





--- In nbwrpg@y..., JP3884@a... wrote:
>        Hell Beast and his small army of Predacons regrouped on the 
outskirts 
> of battle, shy one arachnid. "Where is Tarantulas damn it?" Hell 
Beast 
> bellowed at the others.
>        Aracnia steped up. "We encountered some Allience fighter 
jets on our 
> way here. They somehow magically know where our base is and are 
going to 
> attack it even though they dont know where it is, or how its 
defended. He 
> went to go and man the defense systems."
>        He nodded. Zardus was such a tempermental bitch 
sometimes. "ALright 
> Predacons, pick a target on the CF and blast it to smitherines!"
>        With a crack of missle fire, the Predacons dispersed and 
began the 
> assult.
> 
>        He entered the base quickly with the blast doors slamming 
down as 
> Tarantulas ran. He entered the bridge and looked around. The bridge 
was 
> pratically alien to him. He raced around looking for the defense 
system 
> computer.
>        As he sat down, he brought online the defense grid and was 
pleased 
> with what he saw. the compliment of weapons at his disposal made 
Tarantulas 
> think twice about if he should just take the base over for himself. 
>        An EMP Pulse Canon was what he was rather pleased with. One 
direct hit 
> to one of those jets with this would incompasitate them definetly. 
The 
> autoguns were activated, the half dozen or so missle turrets came 
to life, a 
> shiled rose, and the laser canons were charged and ready.
>        Flare, Scrap, Supernov, Vycir, and Slasys' signitures came 
up on the 
> scanner. Tarantulas' claws flew over the control panle as the 
weapons 
> targeted the squad. The sun was getting ready to disappear behinde 
the 
> distant mountians and when it did the light show would begin.
> 
>        With a crack of Energon lighting, the six bots landed at the 
north end 
> of the CF. Obviously the desnse grid would be up, but if they could 
make it 
> inside and turn it off then the other bots would reduce the ship to 
ruble.
